item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my blog. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Bloomberg Law - document
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: Bloomberg Law is a huge enterprise scale web site built on the Ruby on Rails framework. Data is represented in just about any format. Relevant documents can be searched for, and then rendered on the page in their current format. CSS files are optimized to fully style all pages of the web site, while maintaining reusable components and groups of code optimized for maintainability and performance. This is not a site available to the public Bloomberg Law

item.title: Bloomberg Law - search
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: As many as twenty different types of searches are provided for finding the numerous types of legal documents available. Search forms are rendered using HTML markup and CSS that is object oriented so that reuse of common structures is paired with code specific to one-off instances of unique rendering challenges. This is not a site available to the public Bloomberg Law

item.title: Bloomberg Law - watchlist
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: A Javascript utility for data visualization is used to render financial data searched for using several criteria. News stories relevant to search result are provided in a sidebar. This is not a site available to the public Bloomberg Law

item.title: Bloomberg Law - Reports
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: Bloomberg Law is a huge enterprise scale web site built on the Ruby on Rails framework. Data is represented in just about any format. Relevant documents can be searched for, and then rendered on the page in their current format. CSS files are optimized to fully style all pages of the web site, while maintaining reusable components and groups of code optimized for maintainability and performance. This is not a site available to the public Bloomberg Law

item.title: HBO - Smartglass
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded:
• CSS3 transitions
  • Layout both fluid and responsive
  • Horizontal sliding menus

item.title: HBO - smartglass
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: Horizontally scrolling layout. Including overlays with image galleries and video playback.

item.title: HBO - smartglass
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: An AngularJS application that interacts with the XBox platform to enable users, through their tablet device, to control play of the episode while viewing additional content. Interaction with the device enables pausing XBox play to view content on the second screen, including image galleries, maps, videos, family tree, character profiles, etc. The state of the video's timeline is maintained, so that a user can pause the episode, explore additional content, and then return to either the current location, or fast forward to future scenes. Review of Game of Thrones SmartGlass Experience

item.title: HBO - iPad schedule
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: The iPad version of HBO.com employs CSS media queries. The site can support desktop, tablet, and smartphone sized screens through responsive coding techniques. Although current release only functions on iPads, the site could be viewed on any device or platform. HBO.com

item.title: HBO - iPad program vertical
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: The "program vertical" page of the mobile version of HBO.com provides both horizontally and vertically scrolled content. It packs a significant amount content into a single page, including image galleries, video playback, social media content, and social interaction. The site is exceptionally performant, even on under-powered versions of iPad and Droids. HBO.com

item.title: HBO - iPad paralax
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: Employing parallax scrolling techniques in an AngularJS site, the iPad version of HBO.com delivers a huge amount of content within a single-page. CSS3 techniques such as momentum scrolling, multiple layering, and masking compliment the pre-rendering techniques that make the download speedy and SEO optimized. HBO.com

item.title: HBO - iPad modules
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: "Program vertical" page employs momentum scrolling on horizontally scrolled modules. Modules expand and contract to display even more content. CSS and HTML markup is bare-boned and stripped down for optimum speed and performance. A single sub-one second download contains the content of a multi-page web application. HBO.com

item.title: HBO - shop highlighted
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: Leveraging CSS media queries, this is a fully responsive web site which should work adequately at any given browser window size or device viewport - from desktop to smartphone. http://hboshop.com/

item.title: HBO - shop
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: Users outside the US seeking HBO merchandise are directed to their localized version of the "shop" page by the server after a cookie has been set. Users can select their country from a map of supported countries on this page, or select from a list of counties. A third-party Javascript-based map with SVG components and some hooks for customization was employed. http://hboshop.com/

item.title: HBO - talk - default CSS
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: Adhering to the designers concepts and HBO branding mandates required customizing the server-rendered page almost exclusively in the browser. Only limited customization was required using the provided admin screens and "custom component" scheme. http://talk.hbo.com/

item.title: HBO - talk - override CSS
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: The HBO Community Forum "Talk" pages are served and managed by Lithium. The JSP pages served by Lithium can be managed using an admin screen to make anywhere from very minor rendering changes to large-scale customization. This site has been "skinned" almost exclusively by means of a CSS file which overrides default Lithium styles. http://talk.hbo.com/

item.title: Bass capos - iPhone
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: Basscapos.com - a fully responsive and fluid small business web site. Emphasis on surrounding imagery with text provided a challenge to make the site work on any device viewport size. Users can read and view photographic representations of the product and find local installers from their part of the world. www.basscapos.com

item.title: Bass Capos - desktop
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: Basscapos.com - a fully responsive and fluid small business web site. Emphasis on surrounding imagery with text provided a challenge to make the site work on any device viewport size. Users can read and view photographic representations of the product and find local installers from their part of the world. www.basscapos.com

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: xemedia1
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To delete a comment, just log in and view the post's comments. There you will have the option to edit or delete them.
